text: It's Jeff Barr here at AWS in Seattle.
Here's a couple of launches that caught my eye this week.
Our trusted advisor now helps you better secure your data by offering the S3 buckets permission check at no charge to all users.
This check identifies S3 buckets that are publicly accessible due to ACLs or policies that allow read/write access for any user.
AWS OpsWorks Stacks event sources are now available in Amazon CloudWatch events.
You can use them to trigger an event when an OpsWorks Stacks instance deployment or command state changes and to send alerts.
You can now get single sign-on credentials from multiple AWS accounts using a CLI tool.
The credentials automatically expire after 60 minutes to help protect access to your AWS accounts.
Thanks for joining us this week for some of our launch highlights. For the full slate of recent launches, check on our "What's New" page.
Be sure to like this video and subscribe so you won't miss an update and we'll see you in March.
